bestRecommendation.shortText: funnest place to volunteer/lemurs/fossas/ocelots/otters/mandrills/new giants of the savannah exhibit is coming!

onGuide.name: Alicia's Favorites in the DFW Metroplex

bestRecommendation.shortText: Unique place - part museum, library, art gallery; dance/music studio; poetry stage; movie theater; photo lab and mixed-media classrooms. A great heritage place

bestRecommendation.name: Dallas Museum of Art

onGuide.name: Chilly Willy's To Do list in Dallas

bestRecommendation.shortText: whether u enjoy the art in doors or the art outdoors, you are trully going to enjoy the diversity of this museum

bestRecommendation.name: Dallas Arboretum & Botanical
bestRecommendation.shortText: Needless to say this place is beautiful. I almost had my wedding here. It's a nice place to spend a lazy afternoon.

bestRecommendation.name: Tillman's Roadhouse
bestRecommendation.shortText: skip the girlie cocktails/go straight for the buffalo steak medium rare and a side of mac and cheese

bestRecommendation.name: Dickey's Barbecue Pits
bestRecommendation.shortText: Great meats, LOVE the sauce (a sweet and smoky flavor), awesome sides and cobblers; reasonable prices, multiple locations, family size meals, drive thrus, etc

bestRecommendation.name: Fair Park

onGuide.name: Alicia's Favorites in the DFW Metroplex

bestRecommendation.shortText: In addition to the annual State Fair, there are museums too! I just learned that this place has the largest collection of Art Deco period buildings in the USA!

bestRecommendation.name: Dallas Museum of Art

onGuide.name: Alicia's Favorites in the DFW Metroplex

bestRecommendation.shortText: I love Museums! I also like the collections permanently housed here & the ever-changing galleries. I've seen some beautiful things here; most recently the King

bestRecommendation.name: American Airlines Center
bestRecommendation.shortText: Once again, take the light rail to Victory Plaza and enjoy a Mavs or Stars game or a concert.  Hang out at Victory, Deep Ellum, or West End afterwards.

bestRecommendation.name: Lizard Lounge
bestRecommendation.shortText: used to be alright back in the day, but kinda sucks any more. they have a gotho night every sunday called The Church that's supposed to be alright

bestRecommendation.name: Ahab Bowen
bestRecommendation.shortText: AWESOME thrift store. kicks the ass off of Dolly Python. Daily sales and cool people, too.

bestRecommendation.name: Hotel ZaZa Dallas
bestRecommendation.shortText: Love this hotel. I spent the majority of my time in the pool area having cocktails and enjoying the music. Attracts a very upscale trendy crowd.

bestRecommendation.name: Sol's Taco Lounge
bestRecommendation.shortText: kinda dive-y, but seriously some of the best tex-mex in Dallas. Veggie Fajitas are retarded, same with the fajita salad.

bestRecommendation.name: International House of Blues Foundation
bestRecommendation.shortText: Diverse selection of music & things to enjoy!!!

bestRecommendation.name: Dickey's Barbecue Pit
bestRecommendation.shortText: Great for on the go!

bestRecommendation.name: Dealey Plaza
bestRecommendation.shortText: Where presidents go to die. There's actually several museums and a rather quaint park in the area.

bestRecommendation.shortText: assortment of diverse restaurants/near new cultural arts center and museums/outdoor jazz/sweet view

bestRecommendation.name: Cowboy Chow
bestRecommendation.shortText: good ol' fashioned chuckwagon food. This shit will seriously fill you up...i recommend the navajo bread and chicken pot pie

bestRecommendation.name: Twisted Root Burger Co
bestRecommendation.shortText: Love the burgers at this place.  Some think they're the best in Dallas.  I'm inclined to agree.  Less a fan of the friend chips, however.

bestRecommendation.name: Thoth Dallas
bestRecommendation.shortText: I don't think this place is still opened, but for a club it was pretty cool. played a lot of really good music, and it was in the basement. alas.

recommendations.name: Dallas World Aquarium
recommendations.shortText: This is my favorite attraction in Dallas. It is an indoor living rainforest, I think they may have one of the few captive sloths in america.
recommendations.fullText: This is my favorite attraction in Dallas. It is an indoor living rainforest, I think they may have one of the few captive sloths in america.

recommendations.name: Dallas World Aquarium

onGuide.name: Alicia's Favorites in the DFW Metroplex

recommendations.shortText: You walk in and hear many exotic bird calls. It feels like you're stepping into a rainforest, but it has all this amazing fauna & flora from around the world: p
recommendations.fullText: You walk in and hear many exotic bird calls. It feels like you're stepping into a rainforest, but it has all this amazing fauna & flora from around the world: penguins, sharks, seahorses, toucans, etc. The restaurant's cool too. You get to eat different foods from around the world. A lovely gem!

recommendations.name: Dallas World Aquarium
recommendations.shortText: Excellent West End destination for any type/size group.  Excellent restaurant.  Lots more to see than just fish!  Take the DART light rail and stay all day.
recommendations.fullText: Excellent West End destination for any type/size group.  Excellent restaurant.  Lots more to see than just fish!  Take the DART light rail and stay all day.
